results.title: Taken
results.creator_credit: Cinemedia, XY2, Elisabeth Anne Green, Libby Porter and Hayley Cloake
results.brief_description: When Sophie finds a message on her answering machine from recently separated husband, Michael, she strikes an unlikely alliance with his ‘errand boy’, Jason. Cast includes Kerry Armstrong, Samuel Johnston and David Michod.

results.title: Take your choice
results.creator_credit: Town and Country Productions and Bill Latto
results.brief_description: Presented by Heinz, this documentary suggests that boredom and juvenile delinquency can be alleviated by introducing young adults to the organised activities of the Boy Scouts and Girl Guides Associations. Shows a range of activities available including camping, orienteering, water sports and rock climbing. Also shows the various volunteer programs that these associations support.

results.title: Take three (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The work of three secondary teachers and their drama classes is observed to provide the basis for discussion of the approaches to drama shown, and the methods of evaluation in the subject. Shows students in the 11-12 years age group, 15-16 years age group, and fourth year students in an optional drama course.

results.title: Take the money and run
results.creator_credit: Palomar Pictures International, Charles H. Joffe and Woody Allen
results.brief_description: Woody Allen stars, directs and co-authors this satire of all the prison dramas, chain gang eposes and true crime movies. It is basically a running gag about hero Virgil Starkwell, a master criminal who always bungles the crime (even one as simple as breaking into a gumball machine!), and ends up with more time in gaol than in his pursuit of crime. Full of Allen’s wry, dry wit this is one to delight the buffs and break the funny bone.

results.title: Take the cue train
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Lesley Hammond and Brian Bergin
results.brief_description: This film makes the point that training can help at all levels from grass roots to executive and that most of it can be done on the job. Examples from large and small industries, manufacturing and service industries emphasise the benefits of staff training.

results.title: Take the bus
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “B.P. Road Safety”
Drinking and driving are a bad combination. Shows examples of things that can happen when the driver has had a “few” at the local hotel. Stresses that it is better to “take the bus” after drinking and so avoid accidents which can happen to the driver, his car and anything that gets in his way.

results.title: Take off at 18:00 hours
results.creator_credit: Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC) and Santiago Alvarez
results.brief_description: This documentary shows how socialist economic planning has helped to increase Cuba’s agricultural production. Focusing on underdevelopment and its possible solutions, it examines the mobilization of agricultural workers in Cuba’s Oriente province in April 1969. This was a trial run for the kind of mobilizations that were being planned for other parts of the country in the battle of increase agricultural production, and particularly the production of sugarcane.

results.title: Take off
results.brief_description: A compilation of some of the best footage from the film “Ski the outer limits.” Skiers leap, twist, somersault, twirl and descend in successive multiple images. An innovative skier uses short skis to perform tricks that would not be possible on conventional skis.

results.title: Take me to your Lager
results.brief_description: On landing in outback Australia, an extra-terrestrial stumbles into a local pub to quench his thirst and finds himself getting more than a taste of Australian culture.
